name: Moushumi
bio: Moushumi is a renowned chef from Chittagong with over 20 years of experience in cooking authentic Bangladeshi cuisine.

recipes.name: Chittagong Morog Polao
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices.
Fry the onions in oil until golden brown.
Add the marinated chicken and cook until the meat is tender.
Boil the rice with spices and water.
Layer the rice and chicken in a pot and cook on low heat for 30 minutes.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Shutki Bhorta
instructions: Soak the dried fish in water for 30 minutes.
Boil the fish until it is soft.
Fry the onions, garlic, and green chili in mustard oil.
Add the boiled fish to the pan and mash it with a fork.
Add salt to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Ras Malai
instructions: Boil the milk and add lemon juice to curdle it.
Drain the curdled milk in a muslin cloth and wash it with water.
Hang the cloth for a few hours to remove excess water.
Knead the milk solids to form small balls.
Boil sugar, cardamom, and water to make a syrup.
Add the milk balls to the syrup and cook for a few minutes.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Kacchi Biryani
instructions: Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
Marinate the mutton with yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices.
Fry the onions in oil until golden brown.
Add the marinated mutton and cook until the meat is tender.
Boil the rice with spices and water.
Layer the rice and meat in a pot and cook on low heat for 30 minutes.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
instructions: Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric powder.
Fry the fish in mustard oil.
In a separate pan, add mustard seeds, green chili, and water.
Add the fried fish to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
Add sugar to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Elias Kanchan
bio: Vaban Kumar is a master chef from Dhaka with over 25 years of experience in cooking authentic Bangladeshi cuisine.

recipes.name: Kacchi Biryani
instructions: Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
Marinate the mutton with yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices.
Fry the onions in oil until golden brown.
Add the marinated mutton and cook until the meat is tender.
Boil the rice with spices and water.
Layer the rice and meat in a pot and cook on low heat for 30 minutes.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
instructions: Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric powder.
Fry the fish in mustard oil.
In a separate pan, add mustard seeds, green chili, and water.
Add the fried fish to the pan and cook for a few minutes.
Add sugar to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
instructions: Boil the milk and reduce it to half.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
Let the milk cool down to room temperature.
Add yogurt and mix well.
Pour the mixture into earthen pots and keep it in a warm place for 6-8 hours.
Refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

recipes.name: Shutki Bhorta
instructions: Soak the dried fish in water for 30 minutes.
Boil the fish until it is soft.
Fry the onions, garlic, and green chili in mustard oil.
Add the boiled fish to the pan and mash it with a fork.
Add salt to taste.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Ananta Jalil
bio: Ananta Jalil is a young and talented chef from Dhaka who specializes in fusion cuisine with a unique twist.

recipes.name: Prawn Malai Curry
instructions: Heat mustard oil in a pan and fry the onions until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, and spices and fry for a minute.
Add prawns and cook until they turn pink.
Add coconut milk and salt to taste.
Simmer for a few minutes until the curry thickens.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chicken Kacchi Biryani
instructions: Marinate the chicken with yogurt, garlic, ginger, and spices.
Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
Fry the onions until golden brown.
Boil the rice with spices and water.
Layer the marinated chicken and rice in a pot.
Add ghee and fried onions on top.
Cover the pot with a lid and cook on low heat for 1 hour.
Serve hot with raita and salad.

recipes.name: Chocolate Sandesh
instructions: Knead cottage cheese until smooth.
Add sugar and cocoa powder and knead until well combined.
Shape the mixture into small balls.
Sprinkle cardamom powder on top.
Refrigerate for 30 minutes.
Serve chilled.

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
instructions: Boil the milk and reduce it to half.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
Let the milk cool down to room temperature.
Add yogurt and mix well.
Pour the mixture into earthen pots and keep it in a warm place for 6-8 hours.
Refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

name: Shakib Khan
bio: Shakib Khan is a renowned chef from Chittagong who specializes in seafood and local delicacies.

recipes.name: Rupchanda Bhaja
instructions: Marinate the fish with turmeric powder, chili powder, and salt.
Heat mustard oil in a pan.
Fry the fish until golden brown.
Serve hot with steamed rice and lemon wedges.

recipes.name: Shorshe Ilish
instructions: Grind mustard seeds, green chilies, turmeric powder, and chili powder into a paste.
Marinate the fish with the mustard paste and salt.
Heat mustard oil in a pan.
Fry the fish in the oil until cooked.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Chittagong Mezban Beef Curry
instructions: Cut the beef and potatoes into cubes.
Marinate the beef with garlic, ginger, and spices.
Fry the onions until golden brown.
Add the marinated beef and fry for a few minutes.
Add water and potatoes and simmer until the beef is tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Bappa Raj
bio: Bappa Raj is a master chef from Dhaka who specializes in vegetarian and vegan cuisine.

recipes.name: Daal Bhaji
instructions: Soak the lentils in water for 1 hour.
Drain the water and grind the lentils with onion, garlic, ginger, and green chilies into a paste.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and salt to the paste.
Mix well.
Heat oil in a pan.
Drop spoonfuls of the mixture into the hot oil and fry until golden brown.
Serve hot with mint chutney.

recipes.name: Palong Shaak Bhaja
instructions: Clean and chop the spinach leaves.
Finely chop the onion, garlic, and green chilies.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add onion, garlic, and green chilies and fry until golden brown.
Add the spinach leaves and salt.
Stir-fry until the spinach is wilted and cooked.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Vegetable Biriyani
instructions: Soak the rice in water for 30 minutes.
Drain the water and set aside.
Heat ghee in a pan.
Fry sliced onions until golden brown.
Add garlic, ginger, and tomatoes and fry until the tomatoes are soft.
Add mixed vegetables and spices.
Fry for a few minutes.
Add the soaked rice and fry for a few more minutes.
Add water and salt.
Cover and cook until the rice is done.
Serve hot with raita.

recipes.name: Mishti Doi
instructions: Boil the milk and reduce it to half.
Add sugar and stir until it dissolves.
Let the milk cool down to room temperature.
Add yogurt and mix well.
Pour the mixture into earthen pots and keep it in a warm place for 6-8 hours.
Refrigerate for a few hours before serving.

recipes.name: Chittagong Mezban Beef Curry
instructions: Cut the beef and potatoes into cubes.
Marinate the beef with garlic, ginger, and spices.
Fry the onions until golden brown.
Add the marinated beef and fry for a few minutes.
Add water and potatoes and simmer until the beef is tender.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

name: Omar Sani
bio: Omar Sani is a young and talented chef from Chittagong who specializes in seafood and fusion cuisine.

recipes.name: Chittagong Fish Curry
instructions: Clean and cut the fish into pieces.
Marinate the fish with salt and turmeric powder.
Heat mustard oil in a pan.
Fry the fish until golden brown and set aside.
In the same pan, add onion, garlic, and ginger.
Fry until golden brown.
Add tomato and fry until it becomes soft.
Add cumin powder, coriander powder, turmeric powder, and chili powder.
Add a little water and cook until the masala is cooked.
Add fried fish to the masala and mix well.
Cover and cook for 5 minutes on low heat.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Prawn Malai Curry
instructions: Clean and devein the prawns.
Heat mustard oil in a pan.
Fry the prawns until light brown and set aside.
In the same pan, add onion, garlic, ginger, and green chilies.
Fry until golden brown.
Add turmeric powder and garam masala.
Fry for a minute.
Add coconut milk and salt.
Cook until the curry thickens.
Add the prawns to the curry and cook for 5 minutes.
Serve hot with steamed rice.

recipes.name: Fusion Noodles
instructions: Boil the noodles in water until they are cooked.
Drain the water and set aside.
Heat oil in a pan.
Add chopped onion, garlic, and ginger.
Fry until golden brown.
Add mixed vegetables and fry until they are cooked.
Push the vegetables to the side of the pan and add an egg.
Scramble the egg and mix it with the vegetables.
Add cooked noodles, soy sauce, vinegar, chili sauce, and salt.
Mix well and fry for a few minutes.
Serve hot.
